ResourceHeader.Description: Earth imaging, sun-synchronous spacecraft that also measure measure downward particle fluxes, magnetic fields, electron densities, ion drifts, and provide visible light images on the different spacecraft near the Earth.

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: SSJ/4 Special Sensor for Precipitating Particles, Version 4
ResourceHeader.Description: The purpose of the precipitating electron/ion spectrometer is to measure fluxes and energies of electrons and ions precipitated into the upper atmosphere;

InformationURL.Name: NSSDC's Master Catalog
InformationURL.Description: Information about the Precipitating Electron/Ion Spectrometer (SSJ/4) experiment on the DMSP 5D-2 mission.

Instrument.InvestigationName: SSJ/4 Special Sensor for Precipitating Particles, Version 4 on DMSP_5D-2

ResourceHeader.ResourceName: SSIES Special Sensor Topside Thermal Plasma Monitor
ResourceHeader.Description: SSIES Special Sensor Topside Thermal Plasma Monitor on DMSP_5D-2. The SSI/ES is an improved version of the Special Sensor for Ions and Electrons (SSI/E). The SSI/E instruments measure the ambient electron density and temperatures, the ambient ion density, and the average ion temperature and molecular weight at the DMSP orbital altitude.

InformationURL.Name: NSSDC's Master Catalog
InformationURL.Description: Information about the Ionosph. Plasma Drift / Scintill Monitor (SSIES2) experiment on the DMSP 5D-2 mission.

Instrument.InvestigationName: SSIES Special Sensor Topside Thermal Plasma Monitor on DMSP_5D-2
